text: now for the upcoming earnings release we have some conjecture around how aggressive the expectations have become and what that subsequently might mean for the performance of Nvidia because sooner or later the analysts projecting what EPS might look like they can get a little too aggressive which even though the growth might look really good if it still doesn't top expectations that's problematic and it typically leads to the market not really digging the movements so let's take a look at the options chain really quick and let's see how we're actually positioned we're about equal on calls to puts total open interest let's take a look at oi obviously that captures earnings which would be 22 no we can see that we're looking at a million calls against 850,000 puts so definitely call skew meaningful call skew the reason why I call this meaningful call skew is in big companies like this a lot of people typically hold tons and tons of shares so a lot of people will actually come in and hedge on the put side even though they're not necessarily thinking that they're playing it directionally to the downside a lot of times what you see over here is to offset long options so when you see instances like this where the calls still overwhelm the put side even from that structural perspective that generally is quite bullish now distribution of strikes is kind of what you would expect to see a lot of it
